data.title: What an epoch !
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

epoch = int(input())

# Write an answer using print
# To debug: print("Debug messages...", file=sys.stderr, flush=True)


def isLeap(year):
    return year%400==0 or year%4==0 and year%100==0


days=[31,28,31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31]
seconds = epoch%60
epoch//=60
minutes = epoch%60
epoch//=60
hours = epoch%24
epoch//=24

daysSinceEpoch = epoch
year = 1970 + daysSinceEpoch//365

leapYears = 0

for i in range(1972,year):
    if(i%400 == 0 or i%4 == 0 and i%100 != 0):
        leapYears+=1
dayOfYear = ((daysSinceEpoch - leapYears)%365)+1
if(dayOfYear+leapYears>365):year-=1
if(year%400==0 or year%4==0 and year%100!=0):
    days[1]=29
else:days[1]=28
month=1
dayOfMonth=1
for i in range(12):
    if(dayOfYear>days[i]):
        dayOfYear-=days[i]
        month+=1
    else:dayOfMonth=dayOfYear
if(dayOfMonth<10):
    dayOfMonth = "0"+str(dayOfMonth)
else:
    dayOfMonth=str(dayOfMonth)
if(month<10):
    month = "0"+str(month)
else:
    month=str(month)
if(hours<10):
    hours = "0"+str(hours)
else:
    hours=str(hours)
if(minutes<10):
    minutes = "0"+str(minutes)
else:
    minutes=str(minutes)
if(seconds<10):
    seconds = "0"+str(seconds)
else:
    seconds=str(seconds)
print(dayOfMonth+"/"+month+"/"+str(year))
print(hours+":"+minutes+":"+seconds)
data.statement:
<<UNIX Epoch time>>, also known as Posix time, is a time system  used in operating systems and file formats.

It is the number of seconds that have elapsed since the 1st of january 1970 at 00:00:00.

Given an [[epoch]] time format, you will have to display the [[day]] of the given epoch time according to the following format : {{DD/MM/YYYY}} and the [[time]] in the day according to the following format : {{HH:MM:SS}}.

Don't forget leap years !

Reminder : 
Definition of a leap year in Gregorian calendar : 
Every year that is exactly divisible by four is a leap year, except for years that are exactly divisible by 100, but these centurial years are leap years if they are exactly divisible by 400. For example, the years 1700, 1800, and 1900 are not leap years, but the years 1600 and 2000 are.
The first leap year after 1970 was 1972.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

UNIX Epoch time, also known as Posix time, is a time system used in operating systems and file formats.

It is the number of seconds that have elapsed since the 1st of january 1970 at 00:00:00.

Given an epoch time format, you will have to display the day of the given epoch time according to the following format : DD/MM/YYYY and the time in the day according to the following format : HH:MM:SS.

Don't forget leap years !

Reminder :
Definition of a leap year in Gregorian calendar :
Every year that is exactly divisible by four is a leap year, except for years that are exactly divisible by 100, but these centurial years are leap years if they are exactly divisible by 400. For example, the years 1700, 1800, and 1900 are not leap years, but the years 1600 and 2000 are.
The first leap year after 1970 was 1972.
Input
epoch the time in unix epoch format
Output
day the date of the given epoch time
time the time in day
Constraints
0<epoch<1e10
Example
Input
1000000000
Output
09/09/2001
01:46:40
